content.description: Stand start with a right hand sidepull and a left hand undercling. From there, gain a left hand edge, follow to lip, and mantel on top.
content.protection: A pad. It has a perfect landing.
content.location: It climbs the west face of Ziggy Stardust.

content.description: Stand start with a pair of jugs five feet off the ground. From there, stick a left hand block, get your feet up, and use the bumps to reach a casual topout.
content.protection: A pad will work fine. The landing is good.
content.location: It climbs the southeast portion of Ziggy Stardust.

content.description: Sit start with choice of edge at the base of the crack. From there, climb up through edges, bumps, and a crack to reach an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pad will work fine. The landing is very good.
content.location: It climbs the west-facing crack of Ziggy Stardust.

content.description: Sit start matched on the jug-shelf. From there, gain a great right hand edge, follow to a left hand edge, stick a big right hand to a sloping bump, follow to a left hand sloper, and mantel on top the boulder.
content.protection: A pad will work. There are few rocks around the landing but nothing too bad.
content.location: It climbs the northeast section of Ziggy Stardust.

content.description: Sit start matched on an edge with high pasted feet. From there, pull to the next edge, follow to the lip, and mantel on top of the boulder.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The problem has a rock directly behind it.
content.location: It climbs the west face of Ziggy Stardust.

content.description: Sit start with a pair of three finger pockets. From there, climb up through a series of rails to reach an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The landing has a tree stump in it.
content.location: It climbs the black west face of Ziggy Stardust.

content.description: Sit start with a low left hand sidepull and a right hand sloping rail. From there, gain a great left hand edge-sidepull, follow to a right hand gaston near the crack, gain the lip, and mantel on top.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The landing has a rock directly behind it.
content.location: It climbs the west face of Ziggy Stardust.
